item.title: Rugby club's 'roar' opportunity to become its new match day mascot
item.description: London Scottish rugby club are searching for someone to bring their new lion mascot to life.

item.title: Flying Scots start 2017 with five-try win over Rotherham Titans
item.description: London Scottish produced a dominant display to start the New Year with an impressive 36-15 bonus-point victory against Rotherham Titans at the Athletic Ground.

item.title: Rugby club London Welsh will go out of business next week
item.description: London Welsh Rugby Football Club has confirmed it will seek voluntary liquidation because of an “unsustainable” financial situation.

item.title: Harlequins: Luke Wallace cannot imagine being anywhere else after agreeing new deal
item.description: Harlequins flanker Luke Wallace has signed a new contract with the Premiership club.

item.title: Esher Rugby: Esher coach takes centre stage on ITV London News
item.description: Esher U16s coach Gary Douch takes centre stage on ITV London news this week after being nominated for a Pride Of Britain award.

item.title: Harlequins: Challenge Cup final experience will help this time around
item.description: After narrowly missing out on lifting the European Rugby Challenge Cup last year, scrum-half Danny Care is confident Harlequins are able to go one better this time around, writes Andy Gerlis.

item.title: Richmond Rugby: Richmond still not learning from Championship lessons
item.description: Richmond director of rugby Steve Hill has admitted his men are yet to learn the harsh lessons they are being dealt in the Championship.

item.title: RUGBY UNION: Rosslyn Park staff and players to have "honest" conversations
item.description: Rosslyn Park backs coach Scott Sneddon says there will be some honest discussions in the dressing room after more lapses in concentration cost them valuable points.

item.title: London Welsh: Exiles cannot afford to be charitable at London Irish
item.description: London Welsh head coach James Buckland has warned his men they will need to tighten things up when they head to Championship table-toppers London Irish this weekend.

item.title: Harlequins: Quins put Challenge Cup title top of their list
item.description: Harlequins suffered heartbreak in last season’s European Rugby Challenge Cup final but new director of rugby John Kingston is adamant that has only made them all the hungrier to taste continental success this year, writes Jack Miller.

item.title: Harlequins: Ex-Quin Amesbury treads same path as Welsh star Jamie Roberts to Cambridge Blue
item.description: Former Quin Charlie Amesbury will take a two-month break from top flight rugby in a bid to land a Cambridge Blue.

item.title: Harlequins: Injured Clifford thanks Nick Easter for Quins influence
item.description: Nick Easter may have ended his playing career over the summer but Harlequins back-rower Jack Clifford claims the former England man is still having an impact at the Twickenham Stoop in his new role, writes Jack Miller.

item.title: RUGBY UNION: More frustration for Rosslyn Park
item.description: It has been another frustrating weekend for Rosslyn Park’s coaching team following a fourth successive defeat in National League One.

item.title: IN PICTURES: London Welsh conquer the Scots to claim Championship bragging rights
item.description: London Welsh may have claimed the neighbour bragging rights on Saturday beating London Scottish 36-9, but coach James Buckland is targeting improvements.

item.title: ROSSLYN PARK: Holloway slams "unforgivable" defeat to Cambridge
item.description: Holloway: “At this level, gifting a team a 12-point start is unforgivable."

item.title: London Welsh: Kwasnicki to ride out difficult week at Welsh with trip to familiar territory
item.description: The surroundings may not have changed too much, but the faces certainly have for Adam Kwasnicki, who is back at London Welsh for a second spell, writes Damian Dolan.

item.title: Harlequins: England full back Mike Brown must wait another week for domestic return
item.description: England full back Mike Brown is scheduled to return to domestic action for Harlequins next week after missing Saturday’s Premiership kick off at the London Double Header.

item.title: Richmond rugby: Richmond celebrate rugby club of the year award, despite opening day defeat
item.description: Richmond might have got the new season off to a slow start at the weekend, but diorector of rugby Steve Hill's men could at least celebrate off the field at the Crabbie’s National Rugby Awards at Twickenham.

item.title: ROSSLYN PARK: Skipper has to swallow bitter pill of defeat
item.description: Ellis: “It's a bitter pill to swallow at the end to come away from a game that could have gone either way with nothing."

item.title: PICTURE GALLERY: Sutton & Epsom off to a winning start
item.description: Sutton & Epsom kicked off the new National League Three season with a comprehensive 32-5 win over Amersham & Chiltern in Buckinghamshire.

item.title: London Scottish: Late finishing touches to Scottish squad does not mean they are not ready
item.description: Head coach Peter Richards might have left it late, but he has completed his London Scottish re-build in time for Sunday’s Championship opening day trip to Nottingham.

item.title: Harlequins: Mike Brown prefers to remember good times at Twickenham ahead of London Double Header
item.description: TWICKENHAM has become a second home for Harlequins, and Mike Brown insists that’s something they will look to use to their advantage at the London Double Header.

item.title: Harlequins: Quins confirm capture of Samoan centre Alofa Alofa
item.description: Harlequins trialist Alofa Alofa has done enough to land a permanent switch to the Stoop after agreeing terms with the former Premiership champions this week.

item.title: Harlequins: Bristol have incentive to cause an upset at the London Double Header
item.description: Jamie Roberts says it will be a privilege to play in “one of the biggest days in the calendar” when Harlequins face Aviva Premiership Rugby new-boys Bristol Rugby at Twickenham as part of the London Double Header, writes Sebastian James.

item.title: London Welsh: Exiles get taste of things to come in Championship
item.description: Ebbw Vale made sure they’ll be no London Welsh complacency when the Exiles open their Championship campaign at Rotherham Titans next Sunday.

item.title: HARLEQUINS: Lindsay-Hague off to pursue new career options
item.description: Harlequins’ Olympic silver medallist Ollie Lindsay-Hague has called time on his time at the Stoop.

item.title: Richmond rugby: Richmond will stick to their guns, despite step up to Championship
item.description: Richmond are back where they belong after winning promotion to the Greene King IPA Championship and skipper Will Warden is not bothered if it is a season of struggle.

item.title: London Welsh: Exiles ready for British & Irish Cup rematch at Imber Court
item.description: It’s the British and Irish Cup winners against the Principality Premiership champions on Saturday at Imber Court and Exiles scrum half Rob Lewis is predicting another titanic tussle between the sides, writes Damian Dolan.

item.title: London Scottish: Jamie Stevenson pleased to be back in the Athletic Ground fold
item.description: Jamie Stevenson is relishing his return to London Scottish and the scrum half is determined to make his mark as the Exiles prepare for a season of derbies in the Greene King IPA Championship.

item.title: Harlequins: Quins coach Graham Rowntree can unlock potential in England prop Kyle Sinckler
item.description: Flanker Chris Robshaw has backed Harlequins' new forwards coach Graham Rowntree to get the best out of With promising young props Will Collier and Kyle Sinckler, writes Andrew Lawton.

item.title: Esher Rugby: Esher unveil three new signings in win over Canterbury
item.description: Esher handed debuts to three new players in Saturday's 39-21 friendly win over Canterbury at Molesey Road.

item.title: Richmond Rugby: Brett Taylor returns to the Athletic Ground as Crabbies confirm major sponsorship deal
item.description: Former Richmond director of rugby Brett Taylor/s return to the Athletic Ground as Richmond Women's head coach is a major boost, says commercial director Jimmy Wallace.

item.title: RUGBY UNION: Wimbledon's Croke gets the backing of former England skipper Robshaw
item.description: Robshaw: “This ceremony therefore is a chance to celebrate people like Bryan all under one roof."

item.title: RUGBY UNION: Rosslyn Park's pre-season kicks off with a session of Friends Reunited...
item.description: Rosslyn Park's defence coach Scott Sneddon gets his first chance to watch his charges in action this weekend when they take on Principality Premiership side Newport in Wales.

item.title: Richmond Rugby: Richmond Women trio's Games disappointment tempered by exposure on global stage
item.description: Richmond Women's Jo Watmore, Alice Richardson and Claire Allan suffered Olympic disappointment with Team GB women's rugby sevens squad this week - but skipper Emily Scarratt could see the positives.

item.title: Harlequins: Wasps stars proved the difference at Singha Sevens says Quins skipper Calum Waters
item.description: Harlequins sevens captain Calum Waters admitted his side were gutted to come away empty handed from the Singha Premiership Rugby 7s Series Finals in Coventry, writes Andrew Lawton.

item.title: Harlequins: Sevens star Robbie Nairn aiming for a winning start to the season for Quins
item.description: Harlequins’ Robbie Nairn has high hopes for the rest of 2016 and he is hoping his most prolific season yet will begin with success at the Singha Premiership Rugby 7s Series Final this Sunday.

item.title: Harlequins: LV= Cup winning ex-Quin Sam Smith forced to retire through injury
item.description: Former Harlequins winger Sam Smith has been forced to retire from the game having failed to recover from recurrent quadricep muscle tears.

item.title: Harlequins: Centre Joe Marchant has potential to help England dominate, says Eddie Jones
item.description: Head coach Eddie Jones believes Quinbs centre Joe Matchant has the potnetial to help England dominate world rugby in the long-term.

item.title: IN PICTURES: Harlequins legend Easter calls time on playing career
item.description: Easter: “Having had five weeks in the off-season to finalise it and four weeks now as a coach, I don’t regret my decision and I can’t wait for the new season to begin.”

item.title: Harlequins: Quins snap up Connacht's George Naoupu to add depth to number eight resources
item.description: Harlequins new boy George Naoupu knows from experience what the Premiership will come up against when they face him and his new club.

item.title: London Scottish: Scottish Rugby tie-up brings five youngsters south to Athletic Ground and head coach Peter Richards is impressed
item.description: London Scottish new boy Hugh Fraser is more than aware life in the Championship will be a harder challenge than he has faced before.

item.title: Harlequins: Quins jet off to expand the brand in California
item.description: Harlequins golbal development director Tony Diprose reckons the club's US tour is a chance to spread the rugby word and Quins name across the pond.

item.title: Harlequins: Ex-Weybridge Vandal set for Quins sevens debut in Northampton
item.description: Former Weybridge Vandals youngster James Gulliver will make a senior debut for Harlequins on Friday in the the Singha Sevens Series at Northampton Saints' Franklin's Garden home.

item.title: RUGBY SEVENS: Skipper eyes national title after victorious weekend at Allianz Park
item.description: SEVENS captain Harry Whiteley has set his sights on a national title after leading his Seventy7s to an unbeaten run in the inaugural 24/Sevens competition.

item.title: ROSSLYN PARK: Squad announced for new tilt at National League One promotion
item.description: Rosslyn Park have announced their squad to take on National League One rugby this season.

item.title: London Welsh: James Buckland believes continuity is key as he takes reigns at Old Deer Park
item.description: New London Welsh head coach James Buckland is determined to carry on the good work started under Rowland Phillips, and to build on it.

item.title: Harlequins: Club behind Ollie Lindsay Hague as he makes plane for Rio
item.description: England full back Mike Brown and ex-Harlequins winger Ugo Monye were among those to wish Ollie Lindsay Hague all the best in Brazil with the Team GB sevens team this summer.

item.title: London Scottish: Scottish put best foot forward for charity
item.description: Eye opener: London Scottish players launched One’s Walk for Water campaign this week walking from Twickenham stadium to Gaucho restaurant in Richmond.

item.title: Harlequins: Anniversary year not lost on Quins youth with top four the target
item.description: Harlequins centre George Lowe is expecting a special year for the club, as it celebrates its 150th anniversary and targets a return to the Aviva Premiership's top four.
